Thanks so much ADHDerby,  I’ve been using your releases for about 4 years now and I really appreciate your perseverance, I can imagine it’s so easy to get bored or have real-world events eventually stop you from posting but you haven’t let that happen so Thanks Mate

BTW As someone who uses PDVD Ultra in Cinema Mode most of the time I think this version is probably the best ever as I can now access Blu-ray folders unlike before when I could only access a Blu-ray Disc or ISO mount in VCD

I have a problem too. Powerdvd now no longer plays any of my videos. It played them fine yesterday, but now. nothing. I've reinstalled the software as well and still nothing. It'll show the time remaining, but it just says --/--/-- for the current time. No sound, no video. any fix for this?

I run windows 7 x64 with an AMD athlon II 255 with 4gb of DDR3 ram and an nvidia 8400gs graphics card just in case you need to know.
@scanfox99, I can't replicate your error on a 32 bit virtual machine. Try re-downloading. also make sure windows is up to date.

I just have one problem.
I have a GeForce GTX 560ti connected to an Denon AVR 1912 via HDMI and I wanted to bitstream audio HD.
So I went to the options and set "bitstream audio HD" but when the bluray is playing, this option disappear and I can only choose between "PCM" and "dts bitstream (no HD)".

Does anyone have a solution for this ?

PS : When the HD audio is decoded by powerdvd and transferred to my Denon in PCM, is it lossless or is the quality worse than audio HD bitstream ?

Hi, thanx for the tip ADH. I just installed the shark codec pack, set it to sharks recommended, and hay presto, powerdvd now plays back videos again. It's strange as I haven't changed codec settings since Christmas time. thanx.

http://www.imageup.ru/img265/908814/2012-03-22_213627.png.html from the main screen !:( any idea why is that?

@ Squego: You're welcome! I don't know a solution yet (can't test it atm)

@ quible: Nice to see that it fixed the video playback problem! :)

@ makbt: They forgot to add a logo (dts_es_neo6.png)
They also forgot it in the previous version but I fixed it.
Here's the fix for the update:  

http://www.wuptoad.com/file/2680737542/Media.zip (replace t with l) :D

Copy and replace Media.zip in PowerDVD12 directoryCustomSkinStandardPhoto
Backslash test: PowerDVD12\Custom\Skin\Standard\Photo

OK,.. that worked ...

Copy and replace Media.zip in
32-bit: C:\Program Files\CyberLink\PowerDVD12\Custom\Skin\Standard\Photo
64-bit: C:\Program Files (x86)\CyberLink\PowerDVD12\Custom\Skin\Standard\Photo

Every time I install it says its installing the Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable x86
but it then says it failed to install it. 

Im running Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit

Workaround: Extract Setup.exe with 7-zip or WinRar.
Open the  Setup//Runtime directory and delete the "VC2005 SP1 Update" directory.
Run the Setup.exe from within the extracted directory.

thx ADHDerby luv your stuff used it for a long always been solid im currently using 11 its my main player for dvd'blu'mkv etc although cyberlink does have its issues ive read the comments and it would seem as far as picture quality goes powerdvd11 is still the best option for 2d or 3d im on the latest 2608 can i ask is it your opinion to stick to 11 for the best picture quality and also is there anyway to fix the problem with mkv not using the subtitle tracks in v11 its very anoying i was watchin mi4 all good up to the foreign parts tryed to activated them in settings but there blacked out i understand this is a normal problem but i though if anyone has the answer you would thx again.

Atm I prefer PowerDVD 11,.. better picture quality, less stuttering.
About the subtitles: yes, sometimes they don't work :/
My workaround: extract the preferred subtitle (I use tsMuxer) or download a new one, and name it exactly like the movie

Thx!
